experience.summary:
Artoos Group is a Belgian company located in Kampenhout which is specialised in printing and communication solutions. They guide customers with their communication- and marketing planning. They design, make and ship al the communication for you. Mooose is an online application for the customers of Artoos, where they can order almost everything. Every customer sees Mooose in their own styling and theme, and they can order all their products. This products goes from a ballpoint with their logo to big posters.
After a security audit, the conclusion was to upgrade the old Mooose project to a modern look with an upgraded backend. There was already a proof of concept but the project is builded from scratch. The old backend part is upgraded from .NET framework 4.8 to .NET 6 and we converted the old backend from a MVC application to a Web API with a new Vue3 frontend.
During the development of the project different designs with Figma are created and also the different workitems of the product backlog are written in user stories. When a complex user story raised, we took the time to analyse the problem and come to an agreement on how to solve it.
tasks: *   Convert old backend from MVC to Web API
*   Develop new frontend in Vue 3 (Composition API)
technologies: Agile Project Management & Tooling (Jira, Azure Devops)

experience.summary:
This project is an inhouse project for the IT consultancy company Crax It, located in Mechelen. I simplified the recruitment process by developing a dashboard that shows the current interview status of each candidate, with drag-and-drop functionality. First I had to create designs in Figma and after approval I could start developing. The whole project setup was my first task. Before the recruiter used monday.com but wanted to have more functionality than what the application could offer.
The frontend was built as a React micro-frontend that utilized module federation, while the backend was created using .NET.
tasks: - Creating a simple overview (dashboard) for the recruiters
- Frontend development in React with styled components

experience.summary:
The digitale bosatlas is a product created by Crax It for the company Infinitas Learning. Infinitas learning is an European educational publisher specialized in providing learning solutions for students and educators in primary, secondary and higher education. The company operates in several countries across Europe, including the Netherlands (Noordhoff publisher), Belgium (Plantyn) and Sweden (Liber).
The Digitale Bosatlas is one of the products offered by Infinitas for secondary education. It's the digital version of the atlas for the Netherlands that's being used in the classrooms. It is an interactive online platform that provides access to detailed maps and information about the geography, history, culture and economy of different countries all over the world.
The atlas contains a lot of features, such as zooming in and out, searching for specific locations, and so on. In addition, it also includes multimedia elements to enhance the user's understanding and engagement with the content.
When I started on this project, the product was just sold and hand over to the Infinitas Learning company. My main task was to make the transfer as smoothly as possible and be responsible for the latest changes and feature development that was still on the backlog. I had tasks like: implementing small features, reducing technical depth, maintenance, improving performance issues and so on. Although I was the only developer for the atlas, I was nevertheless part of another team that was responsible for the development of another product for Secondary education. I had the pleasure to work in an Agile way and had a lot of code reviews to develop my technical knowledge more.
tasks: - Implementing translations with Poe editor and i18n
- Migrating from Azure environment to Github (including pipelines)
- Listening to feedbacks and implementing it

experience.summary:
This fullstack project was created with React as the frontend and .NET as backend language. It's an inhouse project for the IT consultancy company Crax It. This project was an internal case in order to test my technical skills in the format of a training.
To keep track of all equipment loaned to their employees, Crax It wanted a dashboard to keep track of this. Previously, a HR officer had to create and print a document, which the employee would then sign. After signing, the document was scanned to create a digital version. To address this time-consuming and environmentally unfriendly process, it was my job to create a web application that has a good UI/UX. First I researched a signing API and found the Signinghub API, which I implemented it to streamline the process and make it more efficient.
tasks: *   Frontend development in React with styled components
*   Implementing bus protocol RabbitMQ with MassTransit

experience.summary:
As part of my degree requirements, I completed an internship with a final student project. Euricom offers multiple different internships, in which I chose to develop the training catalog 2.0\. The internship at Euricom was designed to be completed with two people (which I did with a fellow student), with a technical lead and product owner also involved. This allowed me to develop my team skills and gain experience working together in an agile way, using Scrum in a team context for the first time.

The training catalog was already available on Euricom's SharePoint. However, this had a poor UI/UX so our task became to create a new way for employees to request and book trainings and manage events. The first step was to write a technical and functional analysis. We decided to use React as the frontend technology, .NET as our backend and SQL as our database. This project eventually consisted of a calendar view and an overview of all available trainings and events, featuring various filtering and sorting options. Additionally, there was a personal training track and the ability to retrieve information about all participating events. For each event, it was also possible to request related assets.
This internship lasted a total of 4 months and in order to fully complete this assignment, we also had to write a paper about the project and defend it to a jury during a presentation.
tasks: *   Frontend development in React with styled components
*   Implementing the Microsoft Graph Api for the Sharepoint integration
*   Listening to feedbacks and implementing it
*   Writing a thesis of this internship
*   Presenting/defending the project to a jury

experience.summary:
Resengo is an online reservation tool for restaurants and other horeca. The company provides two main services. One of them is the reservation widget where customers can book a reservation. The second part they specialize in is the backoffice for the restaurant holders. In this backoffice restaurant holders can manage bookings, their table setup, invoices, company information,...

My job was to develop new features for the Resengo Store. The store is a shop where restaurant holders can buy more features for example MailChimp marketing, gift cards, table plan, payment system and many more. During this project I worked as a full stack developer.
In the Back-end the main goal was to extend and maintain the existing api's. For these api's we used .NET 7\. Another part in the BE was the migration of the old database to a new database. To keep both databases in sync we SQL used change tracking in combination with Azure Service Bus. Further to develop these new features in the FE I used React, SASS and Yarn in a single SPA.
After the merger with Zenchef we got the task to set up a new B2C project with the goal to make a fast scalable app where we also needed to pay attention to good SEO. With that in mind the team and I came to the conclusion to start a new project in NextJs. Here we created our own design system using pandaCSS combined with park-ui.
tasks: *   Develop and implement new features in React frontend

references.name: Francis Foubert
references.title: Head of Product Development

experience.summary:
Artoos Group guides customers with their communication- and marketing planning. They design, make and ship al the communication for you. Mooose is an online application for the customers of Artoos, where they can order almost everything. Every customer sees Mooose in their own styling and theme, and they can order all their products. No more need for long conversations on the phone. My job was to develop new features for the Mooose platform in .NET MVC, which were requested by customers and analysed by the Mooose team. Besides that I added Single-Sign-On possibilities for clients to integrate their Azure Active Directories or other identity providers with Artoos' Identity Server.
In the last months I planned and created a 'Proof of Concept' of a new version of 'Mooose'.
tasks: *   Convert old backend from MVC to Web API.
*   Adding Single-Sign-On for customers via IdentityServer

experience.summary:
An 8 weeks bootcamp where modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Vue.js, Nodejs and TDD took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered REST and GraphQL API development in NodeJS with express and MongoDB.

Next, after some refresh of CSS and modern styling, we went deep in the application development with Vue.js & React. Through a test-driven approach, we covered multiple patterns and practises.

Bootcamp was given by JavaScript experts/architects and expert guest speakers with specialization in sub domains such as automated testing, UI/UX, styled components, Docker/K8S, Angular, NestJS, ...

To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read and discussed the book "The Clean Coder" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob.

During the last 3 weeks of the bootcamp we practiced all what we learned by building, in team, a clone of the Agilitas paymate web application. A full stack Javascript application with Database (MongoDB), API (NodeJS & Express), Authentication (OAuth2) and a nice UI (React, Material UI, React Hook Forms and React Query). And of course everything was covered by an agile scrum process with weekly sprints.

During my studies at AP Hogeschool, I created a mobile city game application with fellow students for the course ‚ÄòCloud Applications‚Äô. This was a full stack project where we had to use .NET Core as backend framework and for the frontend we had a free choice. Because we only saw Angular in school and we didn‚Äôt think this framework suited our idea, we decided to start learning a new framework called React Native. After making a technical and functional analysis we started creating the application.
The city game we created was meant to guide visitors to as many beautiful monuments of Antwerp as possible. The game could be used by groups of visitors of Antwerp. Everyone had to boot up the app and one person had to create a game session that others could join. After setting a time limit, the game can start. Once the game started all users see a map of Antwerp, highlighted with all the locations of different monuments. The goal was to visit as many monuments as possible within the given time limit. Once a user got close enough to the monument, he gets points for it. The game ended with a ranking of all the users of that game session and their points.
To monitor the activity on our application we also created an Angular admin panel. With this tool we could monitor all active and expired game sessions. As well as the locations of all active users and the route they walked.
tasks: *   Development of the React Native frontend

experience.summary:
During my studies at the UA, I started a Small Business Project with fellow students.

We developed a modern business card with NFC technology in order to quickly exchange

contact information. With our product we won the provincial finals and made it to the national finals in Brussels.

Intigriti provides continuous, realistic security testing to help companies protect their assets and their brand. Intigriti's community of ethical hackers challenge our customers‚Äô security against realistic threats ‚Äî they test in precisely the same way malicious hackers do. Intigriti goes beyond traditional pentesting or bug bounty programs.
During my internship at Intigriti, I created a leaderboard tool together with another intern student. With this tool, Intigriti employees are able to generate a fully customisable leaderboard based on programs of customers that are active on the Intigriti platform. This tool can be used by customers of Intigriti to have customised internal overview on their program or during ‚ÄòLive Hacking Events‚Äô that are organised by Intigriti.
tasks: *   Functional & technical analysis of the leaderboard
*   Development of the backend API in .NET Core communicating with other microservices of the Intigriti platform using RabbitMQ.
*   Development of the frontend in Angular
*   Deploying the frontend and backend to a Kubernetes cluster using Docker and Helm
*   Implementing Single Sign-On with OpenID Connect

references.name: Francis Foubert
references.title: Head of Product development

experience.summary:
Portima is a digital services company. They provide digital solutions and IT services to the community of insurance brokers, insurance companies and to the customers of the brokers. The insurance distribution market is expected to evolve strongly in the coming years, as competition from bank assurance and direct insurance companies increases. They also observe that the number of brokers is consolidating as a consequence of mergers and acquisitions. In order to make the new delivery model a reality, they need to make important investments and innovations in their products.
The project I worked on was called the repairer project. The main objective of this project was to get an existing application running in the **Cloud (Azure)**. There were 2 parts: * API with endpoints that would be used for an existing application called Brio * Internal application that is responsible for consuming the data that afterwards will be used for the Brio application.
To fulfill the task, we needed to **generate** an **API, internal application, DB, AAD**... My role in this project was mainly generating the frontend of the internal application in **React**. I also helped in the **Backend** where possible. The Backend was written in **.NET** in combination with a **SQL DB.

** I worked in an agile team with 2 other .NET developers. The 3 of us had ownership for completing this assignment. Important to note that prior to development we did the analysis ourself. Ranging from putting together a feasible architecture to finding out the specific needs of the user for the internal application and the API. With daily standups and a 3 weekly sprint planning we estimated our work and we kept an overview (Jira). One of the metrics we accomplished what I am proud of, is that we reached an overall testing coverage of 80% (integration & unit tests).

During the last 2 weeks of the bootcamp we practiced all what we learned by building, in team, a **web application** to manage and display T-profiles. A full stack application with **Database** (SQL Server), **API** (ASP.NET Core), **Authentication** (Azure AD) and a nice **UI** (Angular and TailwindCSS). And of course everything was covered by an **agile scrum process** with weekly sprints.

An **8 weeks** bootcamp where **modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular and TDD** took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered **backend development** in **DotNet or NodeJS** with express and MongoDB. Next, after some refresh of CSS and **refactoring techniques**, we went deep in the **application development** with Angular & React. Through a **test-driven approach**, we covered multiple patterns and practises.

Bootcamp was given by Euricom JavaScript **experts/architects** and **senior guest speakers** with specialization in sub domains such as end to end testing with Cypress, GraphQL, styled components, VueJS, ORM's and Event Storming workshop.

To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read, discussed and presented the book "**The Clean Coder**" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob

Since 2019 I am an independent/student. In collaboration with the

company Impact (Antwerp) I gave swimming lessons 2 times a week to

young kids.

During the project, a **mobile application** was developed to reserve charge stations at the parking of Ferranti. Mainly focused on iPhone.
In an individual project I covered both **backend** and **frontend** **development**. The backend was created in **.NET** together with **Entity Framework** and a **SQL database** running in **Azure**. For the frontend I worked with the multiplatform platform **Xamarin**.
tasks: *   Create a cloud database in Azure
*   Create a UI available on iPhone

experience.summary:
Resengo is an online reservation tool for restaurants and other horeca. The company provides two main services. One of them is the reservation widget where customers can book a reservation. The second part they specialize in is the backoffice for the restaurant holders. In this backoffice restaurant holders can manage bookings, their table setup, invoices, company information,...

My job was to develop new features for the Resengo Store. The store is a shop where restaurant holders can buy more features for example MailChimp marketing, gift cards, table plan, payment system and many more. During this project I worked as a full stack developer. In the Back-end the main goal was to extend and maintain the existing api's. For these api's we used **.NET 7**. Another part in the BE was the migration of the old database to a new database. To keep both databases in sync we SQL used change tracking in combination with **Azure Service Bus**. Further to develop these new features in the FE I used **React**, **SASS** and **Yarn** in a **single SPA**.

After the merger with Zenchef we got the task to set up a new B2C project with the goal to make a fast scalable app where we also needed to pay attention to good SEO. With that in mind the team and I came to the conclusion to start a new project in **NextJs.**Here we created our own design system using **pandaCSS** combined with **park-ui**.
tasks: *   Develop and implement new features in React FE based on designs

experience.summary:
Portima is a digital services company. They provide digital solutions and IT services to the community of insurance brokers, insurance companies and to the customers of the brokers. The insurance distribution market is expected to evolve strongly in the coming years, as competition from bank assurance and direct insurance companies increases. They also observe that the number of brokers is consolidating as a consequence of mergers and acquisitions. In order to make the new delivery model a reality, they need to make important investments and innovations in their products.
The project I worked on was called the repairer project. The main objective of this project was to get an existing application running in the **Cloud (Azure)**. There were 2 parts: * API with endpoints that would be used for an existing application called Brio * Internal application that is responsible for consuming the data that afterwards will be used for the Brio application.
To fulfill the task, we needed to **generate** an **API, internal application, DB, AAD**... My role in this project was mainly generating the frontend of the internal application in **React**. I also helped in the **Backend** where possible. The Backend was written in **.NET** in combination with a **SQL DB.

** I worked in an agile team with 2 other .NET developers. The 3 of us had ownership for completing this assignment. Important to note that prior to development we did the analysis ourself. Ranging from putting together a feasible architecture to finding out the specific needs of the user for the internal application and the API. With daily standups and a 3 weekly sprint planning we estimated our work and we kept an overview (Jira). One of the metrics we accomplished what I am proud of, is that we reached an overall testing coverage of 80% (integration & unit tests).

During the last 2 weeks of the bootcamp we practiced all what we learned by building, in team, a **web application** to manage and display T-profiles. A full stack application with **Database** (SQL Server), **API** (ASP.NET Core), **Authentication** (Azure AD) and a nice **UI** (Angular and TailwindCSS). And of course everything was covered by an **agile scrum process** with weekly sprints.

An **8 weeks** bootcamp where **modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular and TDD** took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered **backend development** in **DotNet or NodeJS** with express and MongoDB. Next, after some refresh of CSS and **refactoring techniques**, we went deep in the **application development** with Angular & React. Through a **test-driven approach**, we covered multiple patterns and practises.

Bootcamp was given by Euricom JavaScript **experts/architects** and **senior guest speakers** with specialization in sub domains such as end to end testing with Cypress, GraphQL, styled components, VueJS, ORM's and Event Storming workshop.

To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read, discussed and presented the book "**The Clean Coder**" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob

Since 2019 I am an independent/student. In collaboration with the

company Impact (Antwerp) I gave swimming lessons 2 times a week to

young kids.

During the project, a **mobile application** was developed to reserve charge stations at the parking of Ferranti. Mainly focused on iPhone.
In an individual project I covered both **backend** and **frontend** **development**. The backend was created in **.NET** together with **Entity Framework** and a **SQL database** running in **Azure**. For the frontend I worked with the multiplatform platform **Xamarin**.
tasks: *   Create a cloud database in Azure
*   Create a UI available on iPhone

experience.summary:
KLIP, which stands for "Kabel- en Leidinginformatieportaal" (Cable and Pipeline Information Portal), is a significant project undertaken by the Belgian authorities. It is an innovative system that aims to centralize and streamline the management of underground cables and pipelines across the country. KLIP serves as a comprehensive database and information platform, providing reliable and up-to-date data on the location, type, and ownership of various underground infrastructure elements.

The primary objective of KLIP is to facilitate coordination and communication among utility companies, municipalities, construction firms, and other stakeholders involved in excavation and construction activities. By providing a unified and easily accessible source of information, KLIP helps prevent accidental damage to underground infrastructure, minimizes disruption to services, and improves safety during construction projects.
tasks: *   Creating server-side logic and APIs, handling database operations, and ensuring efficient data processing and storage.
*   Building user interfaces (UI) and interactive features using VueJS.
*   Designing and setting up software infrastructure components to support the application or system's functionality.
* Creating and executing unit tests to verify the functionality of individual code components, ensuring they work as intended.

experience.summary:
**Agidens** brings advancement by creating solutions that increase efficiency, quality, safety and reliability. Therefore they offer advice & engineering, automated solutions and maintenance & service support for the Life Sciences, Food & Beverage, Fine Chemicals and Bulk Liquid Storage markets.
Bulk Liquid Storage has been providing reliable and fit for purpose process and **automation solutions for bulk liquid storage** terminals for over 50 years. In doing so, they always strive for flexible solutions that increase efficiency and at the same time ensure that the terminal complies with the latest (safety) standards.
The solution **Order-2-Cash** allows customers to register client nominations for a specific terminal and register relevant ship, barge, train or truck information and/or destination or source storage tanks. An **Agile Euricom Team** has build this solution from scratch in **Co-Sourcing** with the client.
tasks: *   Figuring out new methods to simplify the implementations of user stories and improving code reusability for further development.

experience.summary:
Acerta is a social security office, HR partner and international payroll service provider.

At Acerta Arren is responsible for the development and maintenance of the document management system (DMS) responsible for handling archiving, distributing and generating millions of documents in a distributed and highly concurrent .NET system.
tasks: *   Creating and Improving support tools and queries

experience.summary:
Music manager is an application used to manage your music from third parties like Spotify and Soundcloud. It adds additional features and makes all your music available in one place.
Arren works on the application under guidance of Guy, Senior .NET Developer at Euricom. Who reviews the app weekly with Arren to ensure quality and increase performance.
The application will make it easy for people to manage their music in one place so it is not split into several providers. Provided features will help sync across those providers and help manage your music.
tasks: *   Creating and implementing datamodel using EF Core
*   Researching and working with external APIs

experience.summary: Indepth training by a senior .NET architect/coach to level-up his .NET development skills
tasks: *   Several tracks in Pluralsight (.NET learning courses)
*   Development of a PoC to apply new learned skills

experience.summary:
MWingz is the joint venture that has been created to plan, build and operate the common grid. This joint venture is owned by Proximus and Orange Belgium and is based in Brussels.

Mobile access network sharing is implemented by many operators worldwide and in Europe. By sharing parts of the mobile network access infrastructure, operators can increase the efficiency of network operations and ensure sustainable investments in new network technologies.

Arren worked in a team of 8 developers to develop a large application to plan, build and operate a common grid.
Mobile access network sharing between Proximus and Orange Belgium will allow a faster and more comprehensive 5G roll-out in Belgium. The common grid will improve coverage.
Arren worked on a full-stack application that functioned as a skills platform. In this platform users could add an experience level they had with a technology.

experience.summary:
During my internship, I worked on developing a Fullstack .NET application for the Euricom team: an Event Management Tool.
The main objective was to create a web application that would provide employees with a clear overview of event planning (for example for learning sessions, conferences, keynote speakers, and more). This application was specifically designed for events like the Dev Cruise, a 4-day trip where various speakers would hold sessions. Users could utilize the application to book sessions, while event organizers could access a centralized schedule with all the relevant details such as location, timing, speakers, and content.
tasks: To kickstart the project, I conducted a thorough analysis of the existing situation, which led to the creation of user stories. These user stories were then broken down into sprints of 2 weeks, with each sprint resulting in the delivery of a new feature or product.
For testing purposes, I employed Xunit and Jest as unit testing frameworks.

experience.summary:
The 8-week bootcamp focused on modern JavaScript/TypeScript with React and Angular, DotNet Core and TDD. It began with JavaScript fundamentals and progressed to backend development with DotNet and NodeJS. We then delved into application development with Angular & React, emphasizing test-driven development and covering various patterns and practices.

The bootcamp was led by Euricom experts/architects and senior guest speakers who specialized in areas such as end-to-end testing with Playwright, Figma, NgRx, web security, architecture patterns, and containerization with Docker .

To gain insight into professional software development, we read, discussed, and presented "The Clean Coder" by Robert Cecil Martin, also known as Uncle Bob.

To gain insight into professional software development, we read, discussed, and presented "The Clean Coder" by Robert Cecil Martin, also known as Uncle Bob.

Zabun offers a platform for the real estate market. The platform allows customers to manage their entire real estate business. Such as the properties they are selling, their potential buyers or renters but also make and track appointments with them.
tasks: Working in a scrum environment, I was part of a team that rebuild the old platform into a new version. This new version was build with Blazor as a front-end, and .NET microservices as a backend.
technologies: UI, unit and integration tests development

references.quote: Bryce is a very nice team player with great commitment.  He shows initiative and acts pro active in refactoring tasks. I was very satisfied with the performance and the quality he delivered.
references.name: Ben Croughs
references.title: .NET Team lead

experience.summary:
This company offers a SaaS platform to simplify the customs management of its customers. This platform is divided into different modules. Each of these modules is developed by one or more teams, of which I was part.

My task was to further expand the existing modules with new functionalities together with my team. For this I used various Azure services such as Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage. I also helped developing new modules for which I used the latest version of .NET. Within the organization, it is important that we test our code. For this I have written the necessary unit tests for all my code.
tasks: Working in a Scrum environment, I participated in the ceremonies and developed stories available at the Scrum board. During the Backlog Refinement meetings, I thought together with my team how we could do things technically.

experience.summary: During the period at this company, I worked on various projects. For example, I worked on an application where the various departments of the company throughout the country can assemble first aid kits and publish them for lending on organizers of small events. The flow of these sets can be managed in this application. This way you can see whether the sets are still complete, and where the sets are currently located. This application is built with ASP .NET Core and can be used by the entire company thanks to Azure. I have also worked on a new portal for patients. This replaces the current and older portal. Thanks to this new portal, patients can easily and conveniently book appointments online, and see when they can come over. This application is also built in ASP .NET Core and uses various Azure services. The frontend is built with ASP.NET MVC. Working on these various projects was managed by a strong implementation of the scrum methodology.
tasks: Working in a Scrum environment, I participated in the ceremonies and developed stories available at the Scrum board. During the Backlog Refinement meetings, I thought together with my team how we could do things technically. For a specific domain, I had the opportunity to think about the architecture for a new microservice together with our main architect.

experience.summary: The Business processes at the clothing manufacturer are evolving constantly. New processes, changes in existing processes and implementation of new facilities around the world are part of this evolution, for example in these domains: Customs, Operations, a new facility outside Europe, ‚Ä¶ Therefore, there are many new requirements and many enhancements of existing reports. Reporting constitutes a very crucial part of the business. Where possible, the need to define the reports as cross-divisions and even cross-facility is big. The different businesses need one unique point of contact in IT reporting. To make the working schedules for the distribution centers of the company, we have built an autonomous solution in Azure. With this solution it is possible to fill in the right data of the employees in a file, and upload this file to the server. The Azure solution will read these files and process them by uploading the data to the database and make a new file which contains the schedules of the employees. In this project we mostly used Azure Logic Apps and Azure Function Apps. It was important to make the Logic Apps and Function Apps working perfectly together. The Logic Apps are calling the Function Apps during the process to do more complicated stuff with the data.
tasks: During this period, I have built Azure Logic Apps and Azure Functions together with an experienced college, who taught me the first steps in Azure.

experience.summary:
This assignment was an internship assignment. During this internship, we have built a web application for internal use at Euricom, named ‚ÄúOnline Team Scan‚Äù. This internship took 3 months, and was supervised by internal employees from Euricom, and the school (Thomas More Geel). During this internship a team of 4 people worked on the assignment. The web application was intended to measure how collaboration within a team works. When each team member has completed a questionnaire, a score is calculated. Based on this score, the team leader can see where there are any problems within the team. The strengths of the team could also be revealed by the application. The application also gives tips on how to improve the less good sides of the team.

During the internship, we used the Scrum method. There was a frontend and a backend developed for the application. The backend is made with .NET Core and the frontend is built in Angular 7\. We also have made a PWA application of the frontend, so users could use the application offline on their mobile device. To store data, a Microsoft SQL database was used that was hosted in Azure. Azure AD was used for security. Each member of the development team developed functionalities in both the backend and the frontend.
tasks: Working in a Scrum environment, I participated in the ceremonies and developed stories available at the Scrum board. During the Backlog Refinement meetings, I thought together with my team how we could do things technically. During this internship we have been guided during the different Scrum ceremonies with some tips and tricks.

My task was to further expand the existing modules with new functionalities together with my team. For this I used various Azure services such as Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions and Azure Blob Storage. I also helped developing new modules for which I used the latest version of .NET. Within the organization, it is important that we test our code. For this I have written the necessary unit tests for all my code.
tasks: Working in a Scrum environment, I participated in the ceremonies and developed stories available at the Scrum board. During the Backlog Refinement meetings, I thought together with my team how we could do things technically.

experience.summary: During the period at this company, I worked on various projects. For example, I worked on an application where the various departments of the company throughout the country can assemble first aid kits and publish them for lending on organizers of small events. The flow of these sets can be managed in this application. This way you can see whether the sets are still complete, and where the sets are currently located. This application is built with ASP .NET Core and can be used by the entire company thanks to Azure. I have also worked on a new portal for patients. This replaces the current and older portal. Thanks to this new portal, patients can easily and conveniently book appointments online, and see when they can come over. This application is also built in ASP .NET Core and uses various Azure services. The frontend is built with ASP.NET MVC. Working on these various projects was managed by a strong implementation of the scrum methodology.
tasks: Working in a Scrum environment, I participated in the ceremonies and developed stories available at the Scrum board. During the Backlog Refinement meetings, I thought together with my team how we could do things technically. For a specific domain, I had the opportunity to think about the architecture for a new microservice together with our main architect.

experience.summary: The Business processes at the clothing manufacturer are evolving constantly. New processes, changes in existing processes and implementation of new facilities around the world are part of this evolution, for example in these domains: Customs, Operations, a new facility outside Europe, ‚Ä¶ Therefore, there are many new requirements and many enhancements of existing reports. Reporting constitutes a very crucial part of the business. Where possible, the need to define the reports as cross-divisions and even cross-facility is big. The different businesses need one unique point of contact in IT reporting. To make the working schedules for the distribution centers of the company, we have built an autonomous solution in Azure. With this solution it is possible to fill in the right data of the employees in a file, and upload this file to the server. The Azure solution will read these files and process them by uploading the data to the database and make a new file which contains the schedules of the employees. In this project we mostly used Azure Logic Apps and Azure Function Apps. It was important to make the Logic Apps and Function Apps working perfectly together. The Logic Apps are calling the Function Apps during the process to do more complicated stuff with the data.
tasks: During this period, I have built Azure Logic Apps and Azure Functions together with an experienced college, who taught me the first steps in Azure.

experience.summary:
This assignment was an internship assignment. During this internship, we have built a web application for internal use at Euricom, named ‚ÄúOnline Team Scan‚Äù. This internship took 3 months, and was supervised by internal employees from Euricom, and the school (Thomas More Geel). During this internship a team of 4 people worked on the assignment. The web application was intended to measure how collaboration within a team works. When each team member has completed a questionnaire, a score is calculated. Based on this score, the team leader can see where there are any problems within the team. The strengths of the team could also be revealed by the application. The application also gives tips on how to improve the less good sides of the team.

During the internship, we used the Scrum method. There was a frontend and a backend developed for the application. The backend is made with .NET Core and the frontend is built in Angular 7\. We also have made a PWA application of the frontend, so users could use the application offline on their mobile device. To store data, a Microsoft SQL database was used that was hosted in Azure. Azure AD was used for security. Each member of the development team developed functionalities in both the backend and the frontend.
tasks: Working in a Scrum environment, I participated in the ceremonies and developed stories available at the Scrum board. During the Backlog Refinement meetings, I thought together with my team how we could do things technically. During this internship we have been guided during the different Scrum ceremonies with some tips and tricks.

results.name: Cedric Van Opstal

experience.summary: Artoos Group guides customers with their communication- and marketing planning. They design, make and ship al the communication for you. My job was to create a 'Proof of Concept' of a new version of 'Mooose'. Mooose is an online application for the customers of Artoos, where they can order almost everything. Every customer sees Mooose in their own styling and theme, and they can order all their products. No more need for long conversations on the phone.
tasks: *   Convert old backend from MVC to Web API.
technologies: Agile Project Management & Tooling (Jira, Azure DevOps)

experience.summary: During the last 2 weeks of the bootcamp we practiced all what we learned by building, in team, a **web application** to manage and display T-profiles. A full stack application with **Database** (SQL Server), **API** (ASP.NET Core), **Authentication** (Azure AD) and a nice **UI** (Angular and TailwindCSS). And of course everything was covered by an **agile scrum process** with weekly sprints.

An **8 weeks** bootcamp where **modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular and TDD** took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered **backend development** in **DotNet or NodeJS** with express and MongoDB. Next, after some refresh of CSS and **refactoring techniques**, we went deep in the **application development** with Angular & React. Through a **test-driven approach**, we covered multiple patterns and practises.

Bootcamp was given by Euricom JavaScript **experts/architects** and **senior guest speakers** with specialization in sub domains such as end to end testing with Cypress, GraphQL, styled components, VueJS, ORM's and Event Storming workshop.

To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read, discussed and presented the book "**The Clean Coder**" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob

Internship Sourcing & Matching tool. This application was a proof of concept for the resource officers of IRD (Inetum-Realdolmen). They will use this to help them make better matches between consultants and customers, manage contracts and centralize all the information they gave about candidates and customers.
tasks: *   Technical and functional analysis of the project.
*   Setup of the development environment, application architecture and ALM.
*   Developing the frontend in Blazor WASM, backend in .NET 5 and Azure Functions in .NET Core 3.1.
*   Secure the front- and backend with Azure AD.
*   Full research on finding the best provider for sending transactional emails.

experience.summary:
To complete and broaden the knowledge on professional environments there is a 3 month-long in-depth training provided:
During these 3 months, our acADDemICTs are fully immersed in different types of technologies and solution strategies, taught and coached by experienced Inetum-Realdolmen consultants. At the end of the process, the project exercise ensures that they really experience how to work together in a team in a project realistic situation.

Xerius guides entrepreneurs, employers and families through their start-up formalities, social security, supplementary insurances and child benefit. I was a a developer for AST (Application Support Team), in total we were with 3 devs, 1 support engineer, 1 analyst and a technical lead.
tasks: *   Maintaining and bug-fixing of "Bizzonder", the digital Xerius Enterprise Counter.
* Maintaining and bug-fixing of "Zeno", the entrepeneurs portal where they are guided through their start-up formalities and related services.
* Development of "MyA", the account managers portal.

hobbies: Having a drink & laugh with friends

results.name: Chiel Bleyenbergh

experience.summary:
A **full stack application** built with **Next.js**, which provides the **React Server Component** (RSC) and many other powerful features. The application includes **Authentication** (Microsoft Entra ID),**GraphAPI** (Microsoft) to communicatie with **Outlook** to feed the calendar with correct data when employees reserve a room and uses a **MongoDB** database.
Employees can use the application to reserve a desk and/or a room at Euricom. As a result, all employees have a clear overview of all the reservations on each day, with the possibility to manage their own reservations on their smartphone, tablet or PC. The rooms and desk can be managed by admins.

A small **side project to learn** the **fundamentals** of **Angular**. Chiel create a front-end application where Euricom-team can find all the internal and external applications (kind of Sharepoint).
**Demo**: [https://euripoint.vercel.app/](https://euripoint.vercel.app/)
tasks: *   Call the JSON file by using a **API Service**
*   Showing the data with **Observable | async** principal

experience.summary:
Immoscoop is a real estate platform with the added value of estate agents. In 2021, Immoscoop was relaunched with a completely new team, which immediately set to work to completely revamp the platform.
Immoscoop also wants to be a community. A community that includes all our professional users with whom we work closely.
Immoscoop decided also to create a new platform for estate agent called agent-portal. It's a tool that can be use to compare selling houses with the same features that was already sold in the past. This will help or bring the estate agent in a direction what the best price can be.

This tool was completely built from scratch and had Chiel the opportunity to explore with he's frontend skill to dive in the styling how it will look and what the best is for platform, to make it responsive as soon as possible so that is can run at least on desktop and tablet. Last but not least adding a lot of functionality where different tiles has there own page behind, the ability the filling a form and search into sold properties and more...
Behind those 2 application to get it up and running perfectly there is a nice team behind of 2 front-enders, 3 full-stackers and 2 back-enders from Sri Lanka where we working as a team or even individual.
**Demo**: https://immoscoop.be/ **Demo**: https://portal.immoscoop.be/
tasks: *   Rewrite the **Google Analytics** setup by modify the events.
The goal was that the data team had a better overview over the importants parts of the website to track and investigate what can be improved.
This happened by having some pair moments together with a side front-ender and the CTO that have a data member under he‚Äôs wings.
*   As a client you had a possibility to receiving some notifications by email from a saved search.
The email was contained only text information so, it was needed to giving a new fresh touch.
Chiel‚Äôs task was to bring that **email template** under the loop by re-building the template based on the design and that it‚Äôs compatible for each email client.
I used for that a tool from Litmus that generate our email template in preview from an email client.
*   Learning traject about **playwright** and investigate how we can integrate it.
After a periode we decided with the team to use it has **e2e test** and create a first setup for it.
With an authentication flow and mocking data on API.
*   Working with **forms** with **validations** behind like a contact form where we using the library react-final-form

references.quote: Chiel toont echt initiatief, pakt de zaken aan met een duidelijke focus op het verbeteren van resultaten.  Hij is een echte teamspeler: heel sociaal en communicatief, wat sterk bijdraagt aan een goede samenwerking. Zijn vriendelijke en benaderbare houding maken van hem echt een fijne collega om in het team te hebben!
references.name: Maxime Passenier
references.title: CTO

experience.summary:
**Ascento** accompanies companies in every phase of their **human resources policy** (internal mobility, recruitment processes, assessments, etc). They are part of the Agilitas Group.
Agilitas decided to stop the outsourcing of their websites to IO (Intracto) due to security reasons in API‚Äôs and outrageous upgrade costs of the Drupal CMS. This means Agilitas had to insource all the 7 outsourced websites / portals.

Euricom was **contracted to migrate the portals and websites to Umbraco / .NET stack with a new front-end**.

Ascento was the first portal to migrate and **Chiel supported a colleague to create a complete new website from scratch** by following the wireframes that were created internal by Agilitas Group.
Within one month the new portal of Ascento was production ready with the new styling guides defined by the marketing department.
**Demo**: https://ascento.be/
tasks: *   Create a complete new website from scratch

references.quote: Chiel heeft ons ondersteund met het front-end development van de nieuwe Ascento website op Umbraco. Hij heeft zich in sneltempo kunnen inwerken in de materie en communiceerde vlot en proactief met het team. We apprecieerden ook zijn oplossingsgerichte houding en zijn oog voor detail. Chiel is er zeer goed in geslaagd de voorontwerpen en wireframes door te vertalen naar eindproducten, rekening houdend met de restricties van de gekozen omgeving.
references.name: Cedric Van Uffel
references.title: Marketing & Communications Manager Agilitas Group

experience.summary:
Chiel is co-creating a full commercial webshop, to have the possibility to sell custom-made products online. He integrated differents features under guidance of our expert/teamlead: real payment method, receiving e-mails (for example a confirmation e-mail) and a back office system to do some content modification on the webshop.

The **MVP** of this full stack application was builded with the **MERN stack** (MongoDB / Express / React / Node). Now they decided to **refactor** it into **Next.js** before the launch.

T-Shapes are metaphors used to describe the abilities of persons in the workforce. The vertical bar on the letter T represents the depth of related skills and expertise in a single field, whereas the horizontal bar is the ability to collaborate across disciplines with experts in other areas and to apply knowledge in areas of expertise other than one's own.
They can be used for current skills but they can also be used to describe a skillset that one wants to grow towards. T-Shapes are common in the world of agile software development. They showcase the diversity and need inside an agile team.
The T-shape generator is a **responsive web application** to generate your current and future T-shapes, look up T-shapes from your peers and export or link to other applications. And of course everything was covered by an **agile scrum process** with weekly sprints and 4 team members.
tasks: *   Real-time generation of the T-shape drawings
* Collaboration and intergration with the knowledgeDB scrum team (Angular/.NET)

experience.summary:
An **8 weeks** Bootcamp where **modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular and TDD** took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered **backend development** in **DotNet or NodeJS** with express and MongoDB. Next, after some refresh of CSS and **refactoring techniques**, we went deep in the **application development** with Angular & React. Through a **test-driven approach**, we covered multiple patterns and practices.

The Bootcamp was given by Euricom JavaScript **experts/architects** and **senior guest speakers** with specialization in sub domains such as end to end testing with Cypress, GraphQL, styled components, VueJS, ORM's and Event Storming workshop.

To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read, discussed and presented the book "**The Clean Coder**" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob.

Vanden Borre is a leading company on the Belgian market in the sale of audio, TVs, multimedia and household electronics. They are part of the Fnac Darty group, one of the largest distributors of household electro, cultural and technical products in Europe.

Chiel's main focus was **modifying existing and developing new applications** for different departments (e-commerce, marketing, sales, logistics...). The **main programming language** was **Cach√©** (InterSystems), which is used for **back-end**. His focus was 80% on back-end and 20% on the front-end.

Because of his passion for the front-end, Chiel was integrated into the WEB team after 6 months to help maintain the webshop. And of course everything was covered by an **agile scrum process** with a 2 weeks sprints and small member team.
tasks: *   Implementation of a new search engine by having a partnership with Algolia
* Adding new features on the website

education.subtitle: Online self learning courses
education.summary:
Chiel is very passionate about Front-end development and UI. So he followed some courses to grow and have an advanced knowledge in a specific technology.
[Advanced ReactJS](https://chielbleyenbergh.netlify.app/certificates/react-the-complete-guide.pdf), [Advanced JavaScript](https://chielbleyenbergh.netlify.app/certificates/advanced-js.pdf), [Advanced UI/CSS](https://chielbleyenbergh.netlify.app/certificates/advanced-css-sass.pdf).

* Collaboration and intergration with the knowledgeDB scrum team (Angular/.NET)

experience.summary:
An **8 weeks** Bootcamp where **modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular and TDD** took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered **backend development** in **DotNet or NodeJS** with express and MongoDB. Next, after some refresh of CSS and **refactoring techniques**, we went deep in the **application development** with Angular & React. Through a **test-driven approach**, we covered multiple patterns and practices.

The Bootcamp was given by Euricom JavaScript **experts/architects** and **senior guest speakers** with specialization in sub domains such as end to end testing with Cypress, GraphQL, styled components, VueJS, ORM's and Event Storming workshop.

To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read, discussed and presented the book "**The Clean Coder**" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob.

Vanden Borre is a leading company on the Belgian market in the sale of audio, TVs, multimedia and household electronics. They are part of the Fnac Darty group, one of the largest distributors of household electro, cultural and technical products in Europe.

Chiel's main focus was **modifying existing and developing new applications** for different departments (e-commerce, marketing, sales, logistics...). The **main programming language** was **Cach√©** (InterSystems), which is used for **back-end**. His focus was 80% on back-end and 20% on the front-end.

Because of his passion for the front-end, Chiel was integrated into the WEB team after 6 months to help maintain the webshop. And of course everything was covered by an **agile scrum process** with a 2 weeks sprints and small member team.
tasks: *   Implementation of a new search engine by having a partnership with Algolia
* Adding new features on the website

experience.summary:
Timesheetzone is a cloud-based timesheet software service (SaaS) designed for owners of the types of small client-service businesses and big IT Consultancy Companies that send invoices to clients and get paid for their time and expertise.
With Timesheetzone you can create contracts, let your employees enter their timesheets, generate and eSign timesheets, send invoices, prepare your pay-roll and export invoice data to feed your favorite accountancy software.
Timesheetzone gives insights on how your business is distributing its time across your contracts, tasks and employees. Turn on filters to highlight just billable, non-billable, employee or contractor hours. Export your reports to CSV, Excel, and more.
tasks: *   Implement new features for both the user as admin sections of the application
*   Maintain the application: review and refactor code, fix bugs
*   Design and maintain the mongo databases on the different environments

experience.summary: Resengo builds and sells reservation system cloud software. I started at Resengo as part of the team that created the new resengo.com. This was a greenfield project that uses Angular 5, Typescript, Redux, RxJS, Lodash and GIT for version control. I learned a great amount concerning front end projects being part of the full project cycle from beginning till end. We encountered a project-wide refactor and introduced SCRUM, both of which gave me confidence in handling difficult situations.

Customs4trade is a passionate and visionary partner for businesses, contributing to their strategic and operational policy in terms of customs, excise and international trade. We provide pragmatic and innovative custom solutions, based on in-depth technical knowledge and experience.‚Äã
Customs4trade is specialized in customs and export controls and offers also managed services via its cloud based duty management system CAS. CAS is supporting declarations in the UK, Belgium and the Netherlands and Special Procedures such as Inward Processing, Customs warehousing, End Use, Outward Processing. CAS can be fully integrated with SAP or other ERP/WMS systems.

* Vitarum is a cloud-based Curriculum vitae software service (SaaS) built with Angular designed for consultancy companies that like to manage the CV‚Äôs of their consultants online. * With Vitarum you can create stunning online CV‚Äôs based on predefined templates. Employees can maintain their CV online and a specific version can be send to the customer to apply for a certain opportunity. Customers can check-out the online profile and download a copy as PDF. * A WYSIWYG editor is provided to manage this data in a very user-friendly way. This editor consists of modules like experiences, education, hobbies, etc. For reusability purposes we developed Custom User Controls. As a member of a scrum team of 6 developers, I was co-responsible for the complete application.

<!--StartFragment--><span lang="NL" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Arial Narrow";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";

Frontend Web Developer</span><!--EndFragment-->
experience.summary:
During 8 weeks we got an intensive in-depth training that was specifically created for learning the latest web development technologies. From day 1 we used the hands-on approach with our real live practical case.**
**

* **HTML5 & CSS:** Mastering the fundamentals of both semantic as well as how to make your web applications render beautifully and performant on any device. * **Javascript:** Grok techniques to add more life and interactivity to your applications on the client-side. * **AngularJS:** Hands-on approach with one of the most popular javascript frameworks. * **ReactJS and Flux:** Reflect our knowledge on a different javascript framework to get a look at the bigger picture. * **MEAN.JS:** Learn one of the best javascript solutions that help you build fast, robust and maintainable production web applications using MongoDB, ExpressJS, AngularJS and NodeJS.
 * **Unit Testing:** Learn a methodology of producing rock-solid, easy-to-maintain code. * **Agile Development:** Develop and iterate on our projects by keeping a close eye on costs and value. * **Git and Source Control:** Manage our code versions and collaborate on projects with other programmers. * **Soft Hard Skills:** Get our feet wet with pair-programming, presentation skills, interview skills, code reviews, giving feedback and more.

tasks: * Our team had to make several applications using the Intel XDK to make HTML5 applications work on several mobile platforms.
* We also maintained diverse learning platforms using .NET, and created a Windows application using WPF and Unity3D.

bookshelf.title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
bookshelf.author: Robert C. Martin

bookshelf.title: ng-book - The Complete Book on AngularJS
bookshelf.author: Ari Lerner

experience.summary:
As part of the SecDevOps team we are responsible to define and communicate development best practices to the business development teams.
We also research new Azure features and help decide the future of the technical stack.
We deliver support to create Azure Resources with custom made PowerShell scripts to do this in an efficient manner with consistent naming conventions and correct tags.
We are developing a Blazor website to monitor the Azure resources and other important API's. There are services to monitor health and send alerts via teams. It also provides a wizard to request new resources which can then be created with Bicep templates.
tasks: Guy is an expert-level software developer who communicates with businesses and clients to design and execute solutions with a team of software engineers. He makes executive software design decisions. They often act as a designer, developer and communicator. Responsibilities include:
*   Researching and evaluating technical standards and tools for a project and determining which ones are the optimal choice
*   Separating a project‚Äôs goal into several smaller solvable problems
*   Communicating non-functional requirements, criteria and needs to software development teams
*   Designing and revising a project‚Äôs structure and diagrams
*   Distributing development tasks to a team of software engineers
*   Quality assurance testing segments of project code and checking for errors
*   Writing sections of code as part of development in a project

references.quote: Guy is technisch heel sterk en toont ook een wil om bij te leren, hij organiseert zijn team op een heel effici√´nte manier en is zeer betrokken bij kennisdeling over gans het IT departement. Guy is de juiste persoon op de juiste plek op dit moment, hij vereist weinig sturing voor extreem hoge kwaliteit van oplevering en is in staat om kritisch meedenkend te zijn.
references.name: Steven Cluyts
references.title: Technology Officer

experience.summary: Development team lead for CAS application. CAS is an end-to-end solution for customs and trade management. It‚Äôs designed by and for customs experts in order to drive efficiency in a time-critical and complex customs and trade landscape. CAS is a Software-as-a-Service solution, which means it is kept up-to-date with changing legislation and tariff measures automatically. It can easily be integrated with your ERP/WMS data and administration.
tasks: Architect and redesign of monolithic application into microservices that is more maintainable and performant. Making sure the team is working on correct priorities and delivers releases in a timely fashion with good code quality.

references.quote: During my first five months at C4T, I had the pleasure to have Guy on my team as Team Lead and Scrum Master. Before my arrival at C4T, his strong personality, hands-on approach, and in-depth expert knowledge won him the respect not only of the development team but also of the rest of the company. Guy assumed a leadership role in the R&D team, inspiring and motivating his colleagues. His leadership and organizational skills have been invaluable to our company. He consistently demonstrated a strong work ethic at C4T and a dedication to success with a mindset to get the job done. Being a multi-skilled person with vast technical knowledge, he is worth recommending, and I‚Äôm confident that he will be successful at any endeavor he decides to undertake.
references.name: Michael G. Langer
references.title: Technology Director at Customs4trade

experience.summary:
Some of my projects & customers:
* Care Insurance @ Landbond Christelijke Mutualiteit
* Podium Dynamic Survey Tool @ Podium
* Patrimonies Management @ Vlaamse Huisvestings Maatschappij
* Alsico ERP .NET @ Alsico
* Barcode Scanning @ AZ Klina
* Timesheets application @ Cronos
* Survey application @ Municipality of Liege
* Plant breeding application @ ATA-OLV-Water
* Holiday application @ KBG

references.quote: Ik heb de eer gehad 16 jaar met Guy te mogen samenwerken. Hij is zeer toegewijd en ernstig, maar ook altijd in voor een goede lach. Technisch sterk in .NET applicaties en een fijne vent om in je team te hebben.
references.name: Danny Gladines
references.title: Partner at Qframe

experience.summary: Designing and developing multiple client server applications for data entry and complex calculations to manage specifications of tires..
tasks: * Estimating and developing the rewrite of an existing VB6 application to .Net.
* Maintenance and customization of the Team Foundation Server to support the application lifecycle specific for Bridgestone.
* Code review and coach an offshore team of 11 Indian developers.

references.quote: I worked with Guy for approx 5 years and can say how integral Guy was to our development team. Initially Guy worked as a developer on the team and showed excellent quality and initiative. In the latter stages of the contract Guy played the senior developer role supporting and advising the rest of the team. High quality and exceptional results.
references.name: Richard Lane
references.title: PMO at Bridgestone Europe

experience.summary:
Development of the HeadCount website. The layout was given in a psd file and had to be converted to proper images and a stylesheet that could be used in html. The backend had to be build using Umbraco, the backend of another company website had to be reused as a

template. This way the content manager did not have to be retrained.
tasks: * Create website using given psd file

experience.summary:
Create an architecture for 2 WPF applications that communicate with 2 webservices to get traffic information.

The Tivie Editor application allows users to send free or preformatted text traffic information to radio studios.

The Tivie Studio application functions as a dashboard in the radio studios to display the traffic messages. There are 5 categories of messages and depending on the severity notifications will be visible for the presenters.

A junior developer was responsible for the development of the webservices and needed some coaching on .Net development and on setting up the SQL database.

This application facilitates the generation of quotations and calculation of margins by the MT&B sales people. It implements also a robust approval cycle by the respective managers.

It also enables the back-office at MT&B to double-check the original issued quotation and margin calculation.
Development and maintenance of several web- and windows based client-server applications.
tasks: Making sure the team delivers applications that aremaintainable and meet up to the quality standards.

bookshelf.title: The Agile Samurai: How Agile Masters Deliver Great Software (Pragmatic Programmers)
bookshelf.author: Jonathan Rasmusson

bookshelf.title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship (Robert C. Martin Series)
bookshelf.author: Robert C. Martin

bookshelf.title: The Clean Coder: A Code of Conduct for Professional Programmers (Robert C. Martin Series)
bookshelf.author: Robert C. Martin

experience.summary: Rombit is a company that focusses on saving lives and cutting costs in a large variety of industries. This by reducing operational expenses through safety, security and sustainability solutions for mobile equipment and workforce.  They created IoT products that provide out-of-the-box productivity and safety solutions that are configurable to specific challenges in lots of industries. To configure these products they created an IoT platform, which will also deliver extensive data analytics capabilities to increase the efficiency and safety across operations.
tasks: *   Designing new features for the platform
*   Working out a new look and feel for the platform (icons, typography, colors, ...)
*   Visiting clients to understand and improve the needs of the platform users
*   Functional and technical analysis of features
*   Implementing new features/bugfixes and the new look and feel in the platform

experience.summary: At Katoen Natie I was part of the development team that work on a warehouse management system that is used all over the world at sites from Katoen Natie. I was responsible for creating new features on the frontend site of the Plato application and was involved in the migration of the current application, build in JavaScript, to a monorepo that is using TypeScript. During this period I was able to work together with people around the world and be part of a big impactful organization.
tasks: *   Migration of packages from JS repos to TS monorepo
*   Testing the migrated code with react testing library
*   implementing new features in the WMS system

experience.summary: For my first professional project I dived in the world of JIGSO Listen. JIGSO Listen guides teams through a three-step team learning loop from asking the right questions to giving the right insights and generating actionable advice. The platform already existed but needed a fresh and mobile friendly redesign. So we upgraded the platform to another level and made it a user friendly experience for the clients of JIGSO so they can fully benefit the HR analytics that JIGSO offers and make sure HR and business leads make better decisions.
tasks: *   implementing the new design on existing features

experience.summary: During the last 3 weeks of the bootcamp we practiced all what we learned by building, in team, a clone of the Agilitas paymate web application. A full stack Javascript application with Database (MongoDB), API (NodeJS & Express), Authentication (OAuth2) and a nice UI (React, Material UI, React Hook Forms and React Query). And of course everything was covered by an agile scrum process with weekly sprints.

An 8 weeks bootcamp where modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Vue.js, Nodejs and TDD took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered REST and GraphQL API development in NodeJS with express and MongoDB.

Next, after some refresh of CSS and modern styling, we went deep in the application development with Vue.js & React. Through a test-driven approach, we covered multiple patterns and practises.

Bootcamp was given by JavaScript experts/architects and expert guest speakers with specialization in sub domains such as automated testing, UI/UX, styled components, Docker/K8S, Angular, NestJS, ...

To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read and discussed the book "The Clean Coder" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob.

Optis is a consultancy company that specializes in Java and Javascript development.
During an internship of 60 working days, a student colleague and I were responsible for the fullstack development of Sportis. Sportis is a progressive webapp with the aim of positively influencing the sporting attitude of Optis employees. The employees have the possibility to do individual and team challenges. With these challenges they can score points and rise in on the leaderboard.
Before these 60 working days of internship there was a long preparation phase where we had a lot of meetings with Optis to analyse their requirements and translate them to a proof of concept. In the beginning of the intership there was a small analytical phase of two weeks where I created a blueprint that discribed the situation as-is, situation to-be, functional design, technical design, ... . In these two weeks we choosed to work with React in the front-end, Tailwind CSS for styling and Java (Spring boot) in the back-end. After these two weeks of analyzing we started with a React workshop to help us to get to know React. After the workshop we started building the application. Later on I also got the opportunity to follow a testing workshop and DevTools cursus.
The whole internship we had support from a software architect, a product owner and a scrum master.

AP is a university college with several campuses in Antwerp. On all these campuses there is a person responsible for the facilities. This person is the principal of the project.
During a nine weeks period, 7 students and I were responsible for the full stack development of the facility tool. The facility tool is a dynamic web application with the goal of simplifying the work of the facility staff. The facility tool is a system in which the staff of the AP college can report defects and submit requests. After submitting, the active and archived reports van be consulted by the reporter and the facility staff.
Before these 9 weeks there was some preparation time where we had a meeting with the head of the facility staff to analyse their requirements and translate them to a proof of concept and blueprint. In these nine weeks we worked with Angular in Ionic to create the user interface and set up a Java spring boot backend to serve the user interface. We implemented a login system based on the schools Azure active directory so it was possible to only give access to the staff of the school.
The whole project we had support from a team of lectors.

experience.summary: Rombit is a company that focusses on saving lives and cutting costs in a large variety of industries. This by reducing operational expenses through safety, security and sustainability solutions for mobile equipment and workforce.  They created IoT products that provide out-of-the-box productivity and safety solutions that are configurable to specific challenges in lots of industries. To configure these products they created an IoT platform, which will also deliver extensive data analytics capabilities to increase the efficiency and safety across operations.
tasks: *   Designing new features for the platform
*   Working out a new look and feel for the platform (icons, typography, colors, ...)
*   Visiting clients to understand and improve the needs of the platform users
*   Functional and technical analysis of features
*   Implementing new features/bugfixes and the new look and feel in the platform

experience.summary: At Katoen Natie I was part of the development team that work on a warehouse management system that is used all over the world at sites from Katoen Natie. I was responsible for creating new features on the frontend site of the Plato application and was involved in the migration of the current application, build in JavaScript, to a monorepo that is using TypeScript. During this period I was able to work together with people around the world and be part of a big impactful organization.
tasks: *   Migration of packages from JS repos to TS monorepo
*   Testing the migrated code with react testing library
*   implementing new features in the WMS system

experience.summary: For my first professional project I dived in the world of JIGSO Listen. JIGSO Listen guides teams through a three-step team learning loop from asking the right questions to giving the right insights and generating actionable advice. The platform already existed but needed a fresh and mobile friendly redesign. So we upgraded the platform to another level and made it a user friendly experience for the clients of JIGSO so they can fully benefit the HR analytics that JIGSO offers and make sure HR and business leads make better decisions.
tasks: *   implementing the new design on existing features

experience.summary:
CIRCL is an innovative building company that aims to revolutionize the construction

industry by significantly accelerating the home-building process. They specialize in

constructing circular, compact living spaces within just six weeks, using bio-based

materials that promote sustainability. CIRCL employs off-site construction blocks,

which enhances efficiency and quality control. Leveraging cutting-edge technology

and a digital approach, CIRCL streamlines every aspect of the process, from design to

delivery, ensuring a seamless and transparent experience for homeowners. Through

these advancements, CIRCL is setting new standards in the industry, paving the way

for a more dynamic, sustainable, and customer-centric construction sector.

experience.summary:
Xerius is a one of the leading companies in supporting self-employed people and small entrepreneurs.
In my team we were owner of the customer facing portal for new and existing Xerius clients. It involved quickly following government requirements, sector trends and business wishes.
My main task was maintaining and developing API's, SQL databases and Azure DevOps.

Fedex offers reliable services for import, export, domestic transport, high and low weight shipments, urgent shipments or shipments without time pressure.
The Stratus project provides a gateway for customers to create large quantities of Fedex shipments. The project consists of 2 major components. * Stratus-Server is an API gateway and provides integration with Fedex services to create shipments. * Stratus-Agent provides customer-specific data transformations in order to create shipments for them.
VeePee is one of the leading online sale platforms in Belgium and Europe. They are focused on selling designer brands in flash sales with discounts up to 70%. Formerly known as Vente-exclusive.com.
tasks: Full stack development in Angular and .Net Core

experience.summary: Febelco is the leading distributor of pharmaceutical products and software in Belgium. Right now they are developing their newest platform, Proficina, a web shop to be used by apothecaries to order products at a discount.
A new web application in which teachers can plan and prepare lessons.
Maintenance on existing Silverlight applications.
tasks: Maintenance and adding new features to a Silverlight application.

experience.summary: Development of a web application for inventory management and planning.
Development of several applications, most of which involved import and export of diamonds in Antwerp.
tasks: Development of Silverlight, WPF and Web applications.
Development of several WebServices and NTServices.

experience.summary: Item Solutions is a software development company specialized in custom software for various customers. Development and maintenance of several internal applications.

experience.summary: After a VueJs detour I started at Katoennatie as a React developer again. Within KTN my team focused on the project Invoicing where we maintained an app regarding all invoice types within a big eco system. As you can imagine there are a lot of edge cases the app should cover so that resulted in a lot of different ways our app should be flexible. The app also had a lot of old architectures that we wanted to simplify and upgrade. So me and my team took a deep dive into newer, more structured code. If needed I added some features to the component library to add reusable code used within the entire organization.
tasks: *   Maintaining and cleanup a big project
*   Working within the FE component library of Katoennatie
