experience.summary: During the last 3 weeks of the bootcamp we practiced all what we learned by building, in team, a clone of the Agilitas paymate web application. A full stack Javascript application with Database (MongoDB), API (NodeJS & Express), Authentication (OAuth2) and a nice UI (React, Material UI, React Hook Forms and React Query). And of course everything was covered by an agile scrum process with weekly sprints.

After a couple of years of interesting short term projects, I decided to join Euricom. In the first 2 months I had the pleasure to follow a full stack course given by 2 very experienced persons.

An 8 weeks bootcamp where modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Vue.js, Nodejs and TDD took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered REST and GraphQL API development in NodeJS with express and MongoDB. Next, after some refresh of CSS and modern styling, we went deep in the application development with Vue.js & React. Through a test-driven approach, we covered multiple patterns and practises. Bootcamp was given by JavaScript experts/architects and expert guest speakers with specialization in sub domains such as automated testing, UI/UX, styled components, Docker/K8S, Angular, NestJS, ... To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read and discussed the book "The Clean Coder" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob.

VMA is a multi-technical partner for big companies like Nike. Their goal is to provide this companies technical tools.
The application that my team and I created for VMA was a entire new app. It was made for maintaining all the electronic devices inside multiple companies. All electronic devices were equipped with a qr-code. This code can be scanned with the app, so the user can notify if the device is broken
tasks: - create UI for mobile and desktop

references.quote:
During this project, Jonas had the role of team lead and senior developer. He took control over the quality of the codebase, made sure the team did what they needed to do and helped with thinking about how we could best serve our customers with the Yucopia software.

Jonas was used to working in a structured environment with clear roles and responsibilities, clear planning etc. For this project, due to a very strict deadline, it was hard to maintain that structure. During the project, however, Jonas showed that he was able to adjust to the circumstances (and helped his team do the same thing), while still pushing for as much structure as possible. Of course, his technical skills were exactly as you would expect.

Jonas is very sceptical by nature. This often is a good thing, because he challenges ideas and makes sure the right solutions are built.
references.name: Yarne Coppens
references.title: Product Manager @ Yucopia

references.quote:
Jonas fungeerde als Teamlead tijdens mijn tijd bij Yucopia.
Jonas zorgde in de eerste plaats dat ik me meteen bij Yucopia thuis voelde. hij gaf me een goede intro om de code te begrijpen en liet me op een duidelijke manier zien wat de werkwijze binnen Yucopia in hield.
Doorheen men tijd bij Yucopia heeft Jonas, ondanks hij het zeer druk had, altijd de tijd genomen om mijn Pull requests zeer aandachtig op te volgen. Hierbij gaf hij op een respectabele manier aan wat er verbeterd kon worden maar ook wat hij goed vond.

experience.jobTitle: Full-stack Software Development - Scrum Master - Knowledge Master
experience.summary: Working at Wolters Kluwer equals innovation and being able to grow yourself in an allround work setting to further improve both technical and social skills. My focus at Kluwer is being the Scrum Master of a small team and having the knowhow of frontend, backend and devops to be versatile and self-growing.
tasks: *   **Scrum Master**: guiding 5-7 people and aiding/setting up plannings, reviews, retros and more
*   **Knowledge Maste**r: making sure there is a regularity in knowledge sharing between our teams, looking out for interesting subjects, bundling them and facilitating them
*   **Frontend**: Our frontends were usually built in Vue (+VueX) with SASS, also dabbled in React for a legacy project and touched on StencilJS for PoCs

*   **Backend**: Our backends are built on the Moleculer framework, using NodeJS under the hood. This enables a microservices architecture with a central API gateway and a RabbitMQ transport layer. For our database we use Marklogic which is a fully-fledged enterprise database supporting triples and a multitude of document types. We load up our scripted modules in here and execute them via endpoints. These modules are created with XQuery and SparQL, two lesser known languages but provide extensive support for working with triples and are advised to use by MarkLogic.
*   **DevOps**: We have an innovative cloud environment built Kubernetes, AWS and Rancher. I helped to migrate our environments as part of a downsizing initiative and still do upkeep/support

references.quote: Jonas heeft me tijdens onze samenwerking zeer goed begeleid. Bij vragen, stond hij altijd klaar.   Als Scrum Master bedacht hij altijd creatieve idee√´n voor de retrospective. Hij zette zich steeds ten volle in voor het team.
references.name: Silke Venneman

experience.summary:
During his internship, Kobe specialized in Microsoft's Low-Code Platform, with a primary focus on PowerApps and Power Automate. The main objective was to develop a CV builder application tailored for internal use within the organization.
The project allowed creative freedom, enabling him to introduce innovative features that extended beyond the initial scope. Integrating the application with various Microsoft services such as OneDrive, Outlook, and Microsoft Teams further enhanced its functionality.
tasks: *   Integration with OneDrive, Outlook & MS Teams

experience.summary:
The 8-week bootcamp focused on modern JavaScript/TypeScript with React and Angular, DotNet Core and TDD. It began with JavaScript fundamentals and progressed to backend development with DotNet and NodeJS. We then delved into application development with Angular & React, emphasizing test-driven development and covering various patterns and practices.

The bootcamp was led by Euricom JavaScript experts/architects and senior guest speakers who specialized in areas such as end-to-end testing with Playwright, Figma, NgRx, web security, architecture patterns, and containerization with Docker .

To gain insight into professional software development, we read, discussed, and presented "The Clean Coder" by Robert Cecil Martin, also known as Uncle Bob.

tasks: *   Development of iOS and Android apps
*   Designing 3D models and animating in Blender
* Next.js & Firebase WebApp for agricultural company Claes

experience.summary:
During his internship, Kobe specialized in Microsoft's Low-Code Platform, with a primary focus on PowerApps and Power Automate. The main objective was to develop a CV builder application tailored for internal use within the organization.
The project allowed creative freedom, enabling him to introduce innovative features that extended beyond the initial scope. Integrating the application with various Microsoft services such as OneDrive, Outlook, and Microsoft Teams further enhanced its functionality.
tasks: *   Integration with OneDrive, Outlook & MS Teams

VEEPEE is a leading French e-commerce player, specialized in flash sales.
I've been part of the Warehouse Management System (WMS) project, since close to it's inception. Currently there are 200+ operators that use the system on a daily basis.
The project started out with the main goal of making the process of getting the parcels to the customers faster, cheaper and in a guided process, to cut down on operator mistakes. Since then, it has evolved into a complete WMS, allowing for the management of the entirety of the warehouse.
tasks: *   Be an active part of discussions with business, to understand the problems and assist in coming up with solutions
*   Analyse, detail and write out business requirements so they can be understood, discussed and estimated by the development team
*   Implement new features, investigate and resolve ongoing issues, and refactor legacy code.
*   Support the day to day operations in the warehouse

references.quote: His spirit and his sense of responsibility are his best assets, even in the rough environment where we need to work in. He learns quickly.
references.name: Koen Vanoverloop
references.title: Lead developer

experience.summary:
CBS is an organisation that is focussed on providing statistical information based on European legislation.
I was part of the team that made tools to gather this information. They had already created a custom software package which allowed the users (mostly governments around the world), to build and deploy intricate questionnaires.
Their existing web solution was writting in ASP.NET, and was working terribly slowly. They wanted to replace this application with an Angular application, which got it's data from the already existing APIs, whilst at the same time, train their team on the use and development in Angular.
tasks: *   Build a framework which allows the pages to be built up completely based on backend responses
*   Build Angular.js components, allowing for dynamic styling and behaviour
*   Train and coach internal employees in the use of Angular.js

experience.summary:
BNP Paribas is one of the biggest banking groups in the world.
For the first year, I was part of the targetting team. This is the team that translates commercial offers into actual targetted accounts, paying very attention to efficiency of the SQL queries executed, as the amount of data is huge and the impact of poor queries would affect all of the nightly systems.
For the latter part of my employment at BNP Paribas, a small team was created in order to develop a platform for multiple departments in the targetting sphere. The goal was to replace the excel files and MS Access databases being shared between all of the departments whenever a targetting campaign was being developed.
tasks: Understand and translate complex business requirements into SQL statements, optimized for the Teradata 13 system, to be run at night.
Assist and coach colleagues in understanding and writing efficient SQL.
Have close contact with all of the deparment heads in order to map the requirements and build 1 common platform.
Create the library of components to be used by the rest of the team.

experience.summary:
Broekx BVBA is a company that provides software for schools, to manage student and staff data, communcation with student/parent, daycare, accounting, ...
Initially, I was adding features to existing modules within the entire package. This ranged from small changes and fixes, to implementing complete changes to the feature set. Later, I was tasked with setting up the groundworks for the daycare module.
tasks: *   Perform analysis on feature requests (both functional and technical)
*   Perform the rollout of the daycare module in several schools

results.name: Kristof Buts

experience.summary: Ellipsis Agency is a digital agency consisting of a team of first-class omnichannel design & development experts striving to assist their clients with a no-nonsense mentality in creating tailor-made cloud software, applications, websites and web shops.
tasks: I was responsible for various aspects of the software development within the organisation:
* back-end development: functional analysis, application architecture and implementation
* front-end development: application architecture and internal technical support
* overseeing devops processes (CI/CD pipelines, version control, code reviews, ...)

experience.summary: Euricom, founded in 1999, is a software consulting company with tons of experience in software development. They develop custom software with .NET and JavaScript technologies for and together with the client.
tasks: During my internship I worked on the 'Hobby Community' project: a web platform for employees to share their hobby projects with colleagues.
The platform was developed using .NET Core and Vue.js, supported by Azure DevOps and hosted in Azure.

hobbies: Tinkering with everything that has a USB port

experience.summary:
Liese developed a recruitement tool for Euricom together with another intern. The tool allows our recruiter to manage both vacancies and applicants. By linking applicants to existing those vacancies it was possible to follow their status, add comments and hire or reject them.
The tool is written in the T3 stack, linked to Azure AD and MongoDB. During this internship she worked scrum-based. They performed a two-weekly demo from the application. She was also co-responsible for the functional and technical analyse, together with the Euricom PO.

The 8-week bootcamp focused on modern JavaScript/TypeScript with React and Angular, DotNet Core and TDD. It began with JavaScript fundamentals and progressed to backend development with DotNet and NodeJS. We then delved into application development with Angular & React, emphasizing test-driven development and covering various patterns and practices.

The bootcamp was led by Euricom JavaScript experts/architects and senior guest speakers who specialized in areas such as end-to-end testing with Playwright, Figma, NgRx, web security, architecture patterns, and containerization with Docker .

To gain insight into professional software development, we read, discussed, and presented "The Clean Coder" by Robert Cecil Martin, also known as Uncle Bob.

tasks: Finetuning new ideas for features and describing them in the form of user stories

experience.summary:
VEEPEE is a leading French e-commerce player, specialized in flash sales.

She has been part of the Warehouse Management System (WMS) project. Currently there are 200+ operators that use the system on a daily basis. The project started out with the main goal of making the process of getting the parcels to the customers faster, cheaper and in a guided process, to cut down on operator mistakes. Since then, it has evolved into a complete WMS, allowing for the management of the entirety of the warehouse.

As a Process Specialist Lise was responsible for writing and optimizing processes, generating reports in Tableau. She was also operationally responsible for 3PLA and for making functional improvements in WMS.

After 2 years she took on the role of Product Proxy Owner and later Junior Product Owner where she was responsible of writing out user stories and POC's for the warehouse.
tasks: * **Organising and leading discussion** with business in order to have a view on their wishes and problems.
* **Analysing the collected info** and come up with short term as well as long term solutions.
*   **Designing new features** and describing them in the form of **user stories**
*   **Organise functional meetings** with the development team in order to make sure the user stories are understood well and if needed, give extra explanation or **adapt the user stories**
*   **Design multiple possible solutions**/improvements and discuss them with business in order to come to a mutual agreement

* Organise meetings with the Lead developer to have his first input on several possible scenario's which would be presented to business as well as to **align on the progress** of the team (shared Scrum master Role)
* **Follow up and analyse the daily support** provided to the warehouse in order to react fast on possible missed bugs or improvements on short term.
* Providing training documentation in the form of **release notes** as well as **procedures and schema's**
* Discussing and **designing of the road map**

* Define the dependencies on other teams and take them into account when setting up the **roadmap and sprints
**

results.name: Lorenz Reweghs

experience.summary:
As a React Software Developer I was responsible for the FAST (Fleet Automatic Statistics & Tracking) project, which is an extensive digital platform used by vessels from Euronav all around the world.
The FAST-platform enables the captains and crew members of these vessels to keep track of their progress, optimise their costs & fuel usage, as well as managing all the necessary reports during their voyage.
Since these vessels have a lot of sensors on board, the incoming telemetry data is managed through Redux Saga, which is a Redux side effect manager that lets you keep total control over the flow of your code.
The team‚Äôs workflow is optimised by using the Scrum project management framework, with a particular focus on delivering consistent business value to our client.
tasks: *   Improving existing code through refactoring to maintain high code quality & scalability
*   Writing clean and well-structured code in React using its best practices
* Performing technical analysis to turn business requirements into technical solutions
*   Participating in code reviews and providing constructive feedback to my peers
*   Delivering business value and keeping the client up-to-date through frequent demo's

references.quote:
Lorenz already had a big level of professionalism and this made his onboarding very fluent, the team quickly saw they could count on Lorenz and that he understood what was being asked.
Lorenz is a great colleague and addition to our team. He is professional, has impeccable communication skills, looks for the best solutions and is thorough in his work. Keep up the great work!
references.name: Mathijs Cop
references.title: Team Lead @ Rombit Studio

experience.summary:
A full stack application built with **Nuxt 3**, which provides the perfect combination of **Vue 3** (Composition API), Server-Side Rendering and many other powerful features. The application includes Authentication (**Azure AD**) and uses a **MongoDB** database.
Employees can use the application to reserve desks at Euricom. As a result, all employees have a clear overview of the reserved desks on each day, with the possibility to manage their own reservations on their smartphone, tablet or PC.
To manage the different rooms that make up Euricom's office, the application contains an admin panel which offers HR the possibility to edit the layout of these rooms and their desks.
tasks: *   Creating pages with the file-based routing of Nuxt
*   Implementing Provide/Inject to avoid prop drilling
*   Unit/Integration testing of components, API endpoints & helper functions
*   Using layouts to avoid unnecessary code repetition
*   Emitting events to keep logic & state handling in the parent component

experience.summary:
My internship consisted of a Fullstack JavaScript application which could be used by the Euricom team itself. The goal was to make a webapplication that employees could use to refer other people in their network to Euricom. At the moment, the referral program that I and a fellow student developed is still being used by Euricom.
Employees can fill in a form which consists of a number of fields to enter all the necessary information, as well as the possibility to choose a campaign which is linked to a job offer. Subsequently, employees can track the status of their referral and will get notified whether or not the referral had a successful outcome.
Besides this, the application contains an admin panel which offers HR the possibility to manage all of the referrals, vouchers and campaigns.
tasks: *   Creating a sprint backlog every 2 weeks
*   Daily stand-up to discuss our progress
*   Implementing React Context as a Global State Manager
*   Connecting a database (Cloud Firestore) to our application to store referrals, vouchers & campaigns
*   Running cronjobs (Cloud Functions) to check if any referral needs to be archived
*   Sending e-mails through Sendgrid to notify employees & HR of important updates
*   Making use of Git Flow and adding release notes after every sprint

experience.summary: A full stack application with **database** (MongoDB), **API** (NodeJS & Express), **authentication** (Azure AD) and a nice **UI** (React and TailwindCSS). Everything was covered by an **agile scrum process** with weekly sprints.

An **8 weeks** bootcamp where modern **JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular and TDD** took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered backend development in **NodeJS** with Express and MongoDB. Next, after some refresh of CSS and **refactoring techniques**, we went deep in the application development with Angular & React. Through a **test-driven approach**, we covered multiple patterns and practises.
Bootcamp was given by Euricom JavaScript **experts/architects** and **senior guest speakers** with specialization in sub domains such as end to end testing with Cypress, GraphQL, styled components, VueJS, ORM's and Event Storming workshop.
To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read, discussed and presented the book "**The Clean Coder**" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob.

education.title: Erasmus Brussels University
education.subtitle: Bachelor in Multimedia & Creative Technologies
education.summary:
University that provides an innovative learning environment to its students, with a focus on practical skills and growing a positive & professional mindset.
The bachelor Multimedia & Creative Technologies made me realise how much I love web development, and it stimulated my curiosity and my drive to keep on learning throughout the rest of my life.
Therefore, I'm sure this degree was the perfect kickstart of my career as a Javascript Software Developer.

hobbies: üèï  Going on adventures while enjoying the nature around me

results.name: Lorenz Reweghs

experience.summary:
A full-stack application built with **Remix**, a React framework used for server-side rendering (SSR) which has gained a lot of popularity over the last couple of years. It lets you code the front- and back-end together in an innovative way and greatly improves the developer's experience & productivity.
The asset catalog is an application which will be used by employees of Euricom to order any asset available to them (home-office, licenses, ...). The user can keep track of their order, from approval to delivery. An admin can easily manage all assets & orders to make it as convenient as possible.
tasks: *   Complete authentication using Microsoft Azure AD in combination with remix-auth
*   Authorization using Azure AD roles to differentiate between consultants & admins
*   Use of Server Actions to execute mutations on the server
*   MongoDB database with Prisma as ORM to perform all CRUD-operations
*   Rendering, filtering & sorting of assets & orders on the page
*   Security headers & nonces to add a layer of protection to the application

experience.summary:
As a React Software Developer I was responsible for the FAST (Fleet Automatic Statistics & Tracking) project, which is an extensive digital platform used by vessels from Euronav all around the world.
The FAST-platform enables the captains and crew members of these vessels to keep track of their progress, optimise their costs & fuel usage, as well as managing all the necessary reports during their voyage.
Since these vessels have a lot of sensors on board, the incoming telemetry data is managed through Redux Saga, which is a Redux side effect manager that lets you keep total control over the flow of your code.
The team‚Äôs workflow is optimised by using the Scrum project management framework, with a particular focus on delivering consistent business value to our client.
tasks: *   Improving existing code through refactoring to maintain high code quality & scalability
*   Writing clean and well-structured code in React using its best practices
* Performing technical analysis to turn business requirements into technical solutions
*   Participating in code reviews and providing constructive feedback to my peers
*   Delivering business value and keeping the client up-to-date through frequent demo's

references.quote:
Lorenz already had a big level of professionalism and this made his onboarding very fluent, the team quickly saw they could count on Lorenz and that he understood what was being asked.
Lorenz is a great colleague and addition to our team. He is professional, has impeccable communication skills, looks for the best solutions and is thorough in his work. Keep up the great work!
references.name: Mathijs Cop
references.title: Team Lead @ Rombit Studio

experience.summary:
A full-stack application built with **Nuxt 3**, which provides the perfect combination of **Vue 3** (Composition API), Server-Side Rendering and many other powerful features. The application includes Authentication (**Azure AD**) and uses a **MongoDB** database.
Employees can use the application to reserve desks at Euricom. As a result, all employees have a clear overview of the reserved desks on each day, with the possibility to manage their own reservations on their smartphone, tablet or PC.
To manage the different rooms that make up Euricom's office, the application contains an admin panel which offers HR the possibility to edit the layout of these rooms and their desks.
tasks: *   Creating pages with the file-based routing of Nuxt
*   Implementing Provide/Inject to avoid prop drilling
*   Unit/Integration testing of components, API endpoints & helper functions
*   Using layouts to avoid unnecessary code repetition
*   Emitting events to keep logic & state handling in the parent component

experience.summary:
My internship consisted of a Fullstack JavaScript application which could be used by the Euricom team itself. The goal was to make a webapplication that employees could use to refer other people in their network to Euricom. At the moment, the referral program that I and a fellow student developed is still being used by Euricom.
Employees can fill in a form which consists of a number of fields to enter all the necessary information, as well as the possibility to choose a campaign which is linked to a job offer. Subsequently, employees can track the status of their referral and will get notified whether or not the referral had a successful outcome.
Besides this, the application contains an admin panel which offers HR the possibility to manage all of the referrals, vouchers and campaigns.
tasks: *   Creating a sprint backlog every 2 weeks
*   Daily stand-up to discuss our progress
*   Implementing React Context as a Global State Manager
*   Connecting a database (Cloud Firestore) to our application to store referrals, vouchers & campaigns
*   Running cronjobs (Cloud Functions) to check if any referral needs to be archived
*   Sending e-mails through Sendgrid to notify employees & HR of important updates
*   Making use of Git Flow and adding release notes after every sprint

experience.summary: A full-stack application with **database** (MongoDB), **API** (NodeJS & Express), **authentication** (Azure AD) and a nice **UI** (React and TailwindCSS). Everything was covered by an **agile scrum process** with weekly sprints.

An **8 weeks** bootcamp where modern **JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular and TDD** took central stage. The bootcamp started off with the fundamentals of JavaScript. Once everyone had a good grasp of the basics, we covered backend development in **NodeJS** with Express and MongoDB. Next, after some refresh of CSS and **refactoring techniques**, we went deep in the application development with Angular & React. Through a **test-driven approach**, we covered multiple patterns and practises.
Bootcamp was given by Euricom JavaScript **experts/architects** and **senior guest speakers** with specialization in sub domains such as end to end testing with Cypress, GraphQL, styled components, VueJS, ORM's and Event Storming workshop.
To get a better idea of what makes a software developer a "professional", we read, discussed and presented the book "**The Clean Coder**" by Robert Cecil Martin otherwise known as Uncle Bob.

experience.summary:
A full-stack application built with **Remix**, a React framework used for server-side rendering (SSR) which has gained a lot of popularity over the last couple of years. It lets you code the front- and back-end together in an innovative way and greatly improves the developer's experience & productivity.
The asset catalog is an application which will be used by employees of Euricom to order any asset available to them (home-office, licenses, ...). The user can keep track of their order, from approval to delivery. An admin can easily manage all assets & orders to make it as convenient as possible.
tasks: *   Complete authentication using Microsoft Azure AD in combination with remix-auth
*   Authorization using Azure AD roles to differentiate between consultants & admins
*   Use of Server Actions to execute mutations on the server
*   MongoDB database with Prisma as ORM to perform all CRUD-operations
*   Rendering, filtering & sorting of assets & orders on the page
*   Security headers & nonces to add a layer of protection to the application

experience.summary:
As a personal project, I developed an innovative application designed to track individual kilometres driven. Leveraging the power of React JS for the frontend and NodeJS for the backend, the primary goal was to create a robust and user-friendly system for efficiently monitoring travel distances.

The project enabled me to showcase my proficiency in React JS, crafting an intuitive frontend interface that allowed users to input and access their mileage data effortlessly. Additionally, by harnessing the capabilities of NodeJS for the backend, I successfully implemented secure data storage and retrieval.

The application was scalable, adaptable and integrated various analytical features to provide insightful data visualisations (graphs and charts).

Overall, the application's success demonstrated my expertise in developing full-stack solutions, particularly in React JS and NodeJS.

During his internship, Maarten specialized in Microsoft's Low-Code Platform, with a primary focus on PowerApps and Power Automate. The main objective was to develop a CV builder application tailored for internal use within the organization.

The project allowed creative freedom, enabling him to introduce innovative features that extended beyond the initial scope. Integrating the application with various Microsoft services such as OneDrive, Outlook, and Microsoft Teams further enhanced its functionality.
tasks: *   Integration with OneDrive, Outlook & MS Teams

experience.summary:
The 8-week bootcamp focused on modern JavaScript/TypeScript with React and Angular, .Net Core and TDD. It began with JavaScript fundamentals and progressed to backend development with DotNet and NodeJS. We then delved into application development with Angular & React, emphasizing test-driven development and covering various patterns and practices.

The bootcamp was led by Euricom JavaScript experts/architects and senior guest speakers who specialized in areas such as end-to-end testing with Playwright, Figma, NgRx, web security, architecture patterns, and containerization with Docker .

To gain insight into professional software development, we read, discussed, and presented "The Clean Coder" by Robert Cecil Martin, also known as Uncle Bob.

experience.summary:
As of september 2021 I fulfill the role of functional/agile analyst fulltime.

**_Renovatieplanner_** is an application where the users can manage and plan their renovations.

**_FIS, Financieel Informatie Systeem,_** is a digital platform where the users can view their bank statements, their reports for their fiscal year and can submit their payment requests.

Within VMSW I fulfilled the role of functional/agile analyst and as Full Stack Developer.

_**Conditiemeting**_ is an application where the VMSW can assign a epb score to buildings in their patrimony, and the lowest scored buildings will get chosen to be renovate first.

**_Woningkenmerken_** is an extension on Conditiemeting (Phase 2), adding the functionalities for the users to add rent estimates and plan their renovations.

Mainly for Novell products

Programming languages & related products:

‚¶Å Novell (Identity Manager, Access Manager, eDir, User Application, OpenSuse, SLES)

Create website for timesheets and payroll to be recorded
Website CMS expansion, with packaging capability, ogone payments, ...
Create IE Toolbar for telenet
Website creation for general management of employees and employers
Export (Data) / Write reports module to Excel
Importer to migrate files from **Neglect-X** into **RWO**
Website for GSM and Accessories supplier

This ASP.NET Webforms application allows any office to fully automate its administrative and commercial tasks. The program's parameters can be customized, and it therefore targets both independent brokers and larger offices with multiple employees. Even office networks that wish to share all or part of their real estate portfolio can use it.

aariXa developed a web application that makes inventory of homes that are vacant, neglected or dilapidated easier. This ensures that the processing and follow-up for these properties will be much more accurate. Thus, the owner will more quickly ensure that his property is back in good condition.

Multi-layered ASP.NET MVC application to allow freelancers to manage their own profiles, upload resumes, apply for open positions or indicate their availability. A user-friendly search portal for account managers to match freelancers to opportunities.
A multi-layered ASP.NET Webforms application where employees can manage files and interface with Winbooks (Accounting software)
Development of various multi-layer applications such as, **VISA** (Visa applications), **Border** (Border control), **Expedition** (Send Diplomatic bags), **Extension** (Visa stickers extensions)

The **MOBIB** card, is a chip card issued by STIB on which various transport tickets can be loaded. Progressively, this card replaces the traditional paper tickets at STIB and at SNCB for combined season tickets. Through its technology, the MOBIB card allows more flexibility and opens the door to a number of new possibilities.

**MyBootik** is a state-of-the-art ASP.NET MVC Application (Web Shop) to sell mobibcards with corresponding subscriptions/tickets, built according to STIB reference architecture

**Excell** consists of multiple applications, that are responsible for the Order-To-Invoice flow at BPost. These applications are written in Java and in .Net.

¬∑ **EVS** = Event Service

The goal is to migrate all of the different products that BPost offer, that all have their own separate applications and business models, to Excell.

Performance tweaking by refactoring code and changing database structure.

experience.summary: During 7 weeks, we train skilled junior/medior developers in new technology standards like **.NET Core, Angular 2 and NodeJS**. We do this with the necessary attention for quality checks (unit testing) and looking under the hood of a library. We link this with modern technical designs, patterns and practises as microservices, event sourcing and containers. And investigate how we can deploy this on AWS, Azure and the google cloud platform.
tasks: *   The 1st week we have a look at patterns and practises as microservices, event sourcing and containers(**Docker**). We investigate how we can deploy this on **AWS, Azure** and the google cloud platform.

*   During the 2nd week, we focus on the **Microsoft .NET Core framework**. Besides that, we examine how we can **secure** modern technical designs and cloud solutions in the best way possible. With our hands-on approach, we also give attention to **unit testing** our code to optimize our work efficiency.
*   In the third week, it‚Äôs time to use our knowledge to solve a case. The best way to learn is by **practising under supervision of our experts**.
*   Week 4 we sharpen our Javascript skills. We use **NodeJS** to explain certain **Advanced Javascript** topics which means we do a lot of unit testing again.

*   In the next week we take a dive in the frontend technology of the moment, **Angular**. Euricom already trained more than twenty people in terms of frontend tech. Because we already use it with certain customers, there is no better place to learn it than in the Euricom office. We will also sharpen your visual skills with our **CSS tips and tricks** workshops.

*   In the last 2 weeks, it‚Äôs time to apply what we learned on our case. **A secured solution with multiple backend technologies and a state-of-the-art frontend**. Now you‚Äôre ready to help our customers and successfully complete projects with the rest of the team!

This was done so the customer wouldn‚Äôt need training in using Navision. Technologies used: Visual Studio, C#, ASP.NET, MVC, WebAPI, bootstrap, css, html, javascript, jQuery, Azure, GIT, TFS.
